RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Inner turf CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 105000. INNER TURF (UP TO $18,270 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 20 23 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment DueA t Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSES FOR DEBRA broke out a step at the start bumping ADAAY IN ASIA, tracked the pace along the inside, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, split foes nearing the eighth pole to seize command outside that station, then edged clear to the finish. MAIL ORDER broke a beat slow when away awkward, chased along the inside briefly before tipping to the three path, tucked to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing inside the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. MAJESTIC D'ORO chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages while prevailing in the battle for the show honors. ADAAY IN ASIA (GB) got bumped at the start by ROSES FOR DEBRA, who broke outwards, chased just off the inside under a ride from the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late going. SISTER ANNIE a bit keen pulling early on, showed the way in hand along the inside through swift splits, got set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat from a pair and was collared nearing the eighth pole, then weakened to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Mail Order
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, ins briefly, chased 3-2w, 5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Annie
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen early, in hand ins, set down ins 1/4, collared, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Roses for Debra
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, tracked ins, 2w 1/4p, split foes, up, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Adaay In Asia (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 7F Turf CR: 75. Maiden Claiming Purse 47000. (UP TO $8,178 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider i t inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WONDER GIRL came away in good order, was well rated while setting the pace, controlled the action while inside on the turn, was asked in the two path into the stretch then came under a right-handed crop, was brushed in the hindquarters by the runner-up when that foe came in inside the three-sixteenths, battled inside that foe into the final furlong, drifted out about three paths when switched to a left-handed crop inside the eighth-pole and carried out the unofficial runner-up, swapped leads back and forth while taking a straight course into the final sixteenth, gained a slightly larger advantage over the runner-up at that point, switched back to her inside lead while drifting out about three paths a few strides from the wire and held. NIGHTSABER (GB) settled just behind the leader on the inside, saved ground on the turn, shifted three wide coming to the quarter-pole, gained to make a bid into upper stretch, drifted in under a right-handed crop inside the three-sixteenths and brushed with the unofficial winner, fought on even terms while both took a straight course into the final furlong, was carried out a few paths outside the sixteenth-pole, drifted out on her own and dropped close to three-quarters behind just inside the sixteenth-pole, checked off the heels of the unofficial winner while beaten but in a precarious position late and missed but held the place. FANCY STAX settled off the pace, bobbled outside the five-eighths, angled in towards the rear, went around the turn in the two path, dropped to the hedge approaching the quarter-pole, came under a left-handed crop in upper stretch, gained into the final furlong and finished with good courage for the show. BELLESHAZZA settled off the pace, went three wide on the turn, was roused five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. LEXI'S SPIRIT broke in and bumped with a foe, stalked the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, was put to a drive into upper stretch and came up empty. JUST A SPLASH (IRE) was bumped at the start, tracked the pace down the backstretch, was asked in the two path on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch and also came up empty. SOLEVO SPRITZ was taken in hand early then guided in at the rear, saved ground on the turn, came off the hedge into upper stretch and was no factor. FOLLOWING A STEWARDS' INQUIRY AND RIDER CLAIM OF FOUL, WONDER GIRL WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM FIRST AND PLACED SECOND FOR INTERFERENCE IN THE FINAL FURLONG.

ENTRY.NAME: Nightsaber (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Dorrian Michael Dorrian Chris Dorrian James and Hausman James
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close,ins,3p1/4,bid3/16,drift in,carried out,chckd late,missd

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Wonder Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated,ins turn,2p1/4,drift out ins1/8,brshd,drift late,held

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Splash (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tracked,asked 2path turn,3p1/4,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Lexi's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd,stalked outside,3p turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Belleshazza
ENTRY.OWNER: Five C's Stable and S and P Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,3wide turn,5w into lane,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Solevo Spritz
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,guided in,at rear,inside turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Stax
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled5/8,angled in,2p turn,ins1/4,good courage,clear show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 80000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEETIE chased five then four wide coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung four wide into upper stretch taking command straightened away, dug in under a drive inching away to the finish kept to task. APRIL ANTICS got bumped at the start by HARLAN'S BOND and in turn bumped DUCKPHAT, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, ran on to chase the winner home clear of the rest and along second best. DUCKPHAT got bumped at the start by APRIL ANTICS due to pressure from HARLAN'S BOND, chased four then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and improved position to secure the show honors. RACING COLORS chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled three to four wide for home, passed tired rivals. HARLAN'S BOND broke out at the start bumping APRIL ANTICS into DUCKPHAT, chased three wide advancing on the leader midway on the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and took over narrow command inside that station, swung three wide into upper stretch displaced from command straightened away and weakened. Following a shoe repair in the paddock, REIGNING CHICK broke a half a beat slow, ranged up to establish the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside, came under urging at the five-sixteenths and was displaced from the front inside that station, cornered just off the inside into upper stretch, folded, and was eased home through the final sixteenth.

ENTRY.NAME: Racing Colors
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 3-4w upper, passed tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: Reigning Chick
ENTRY.OWNER: Walder Peter R EKB Stables LLC and Surging Sky Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 slw, in hand 2p, coaxed 5/16, yielded, 2w 1/4p, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Bond
ENTRY.OWNER: Carney Sean Donk David G and Mackay Douglas R
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, up ins 5/16, 3w upper, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: April Antics
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, 5-6w upper, ran on, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Duckphat
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed near 1/4, 4w upper, up, inched away

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Hidden Lake Farm LLC & Fred Rosen

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 39000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VALENZAN DAY went to the front, was well rated while off the inside, dictated terms in the two path on the turn, responded well when set down into upper stretch, was given two pops of a right-handed crop between the furlong marker and the sixteenth-pole then was eased up while much the best. UNION LIGHTS settled just off the pace while well off the inside, moved in late on the backstretch, saved ground while in hand early on the turn, was asked near the three-eighths then shifted three wide, chased the winner under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop inside the furlong marker and was second best. CUMBERLAND BLUES settled on the outside, passed the five-eighths pole under urging, was roused for more while moving from three to five wide on the turn, dropped to the three path approaching the quarter-pole, shifted closer to the rail in the stretch and safely secured the show. BLU GROTTO dropped back while showing no speed then came under urging, saved ground on the turn, moved off the rail outside the quarter-pole, raced between foes into the final furlong and failed to threaten. BERT BERT BERT broke a step slow, settled at the rear, moved closer late on the backstretch, was asked while dropping from the three path to the rail on the turn, came off the inside in upper stretch and failed to respond. CHEEKY TICO tracked the pace on the outside, went three to four wide on the turn, was given his cue inside the three-eighths pole, chased into the stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Valenzan Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated,off rail,2p turn,ask1/4,drew off,eased up final 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Union Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,mvd in9/16,ins-3w turn,chased,no match,clear2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Blu Grotto
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Gurdon Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: drop back,urged along,ins turn,2p1/4,btwn foes1/8,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Bert Bert Bert
ENTRY.OWNER: Lambe Robert and Cox William J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,settled,closer 9/16,asked 3path-rail turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Cheeky Tico
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked outside,3-4path turn,asked ins3/8,chased,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cumberland Blues
ENTRY.OWNER: Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Celeritas Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,urged5/8,3-5wide turn,drop 3w1/4,mvd in,up 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Pr eferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPINNING COLORS just off the inside tracking the front from mid pack, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, rallied with good energy to issue a challenge through the final furlong taking command near the sixteenth marker, then prevailed going away at the end. SPLASHY tracked the pace along the inside, got set down spinning two to three wide into upper stretch, ran on willingly to secure the place honors in the late stages. SILENT MELODY hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside five furlongs from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive clinging to command until collared a sixteenth from home, then kept on to preserve the show honors. CERRETTA four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, issue a challenge for command a furlong out, then weakened in the late stages. SHINE MY TIARA chased three then two wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled five wide into upper stretch, improved position to the finish. SHE'S A NATURAL settled two to three wide at the tail of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out seven wide into upper stretch, passed tired rivals. STRICTLY TABOO tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out before backing away in the late going. SHELLY coaxed from the gate, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out six wide into upper stretch, offered no response. PINSTRIPEPIZZO tracked the pace along the inside from near the rear of the field, tipped to the two path through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide for home and made no headway. MAYA'S DREAM hustled from the start, chased three then two wide from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened. DREAM ON CARA four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch and tired. THREE CUPS FULL chased along the inside, came under brief coaxing at the three-eighths inside a pair of rivals, suddenly got placed to a protective hold near the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Dream On Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, 3w turn, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Three Cups Full
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 3/8, protected 5/16, 4w upper, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Pinstripepizzo
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 2p 5/16, 3w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Shelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Strictly Taboo
ENTRY.OWNER: Duncker, C. Steven and Quartucci, Alan
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, bid, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Splashy
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club Rocco Steven Lee Jong and Cutair Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, set down 2-3w upper, ran on, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Shine My Tiara
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Spinning Colors
ENTRY.OWNER: Parsons, Jr., William and Howe, David S.
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, up 1/16, going away

ENTRY.NAME: Silent Melody
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable Maspeth Stables and Dark Horse Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand 2p, to ins 5/8, 3w uppr, caught 1/16, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Cerretta
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, bid, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Maya's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, just off pace 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: She's a Natural
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w at rear, coaxed 3/8, angled 7w upper, passed tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 80000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRAKE'S PASSAGE was rated just off the pace, moved out inside the three-quarter pole, made a bid in the three to four path on the turn, took a short lead while set down into upper stretch, drifted out under a left-handed crop, battled outside of the runner-up into the final furlong, switched to a right-handed crop near the sixteenth-pole and prevailed under strong urging. CICCIOBELLO went to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside to the two path on the turn, was asked outside the quarter-pole, lost the lead to the winner into upper stretch, fought on well with that foe in the final furlong but missed while well clear for the place. COLLOQUY was well placed just off the pace, went two to three wide on the turn, was asked late on that bend then driven five wide into upper stretch and lacked the needed response while able to get the show. SAFALOW'S MISSION settled off the pace, dropped from the two path to the rail early on the turn then was roused, saved ground into the stretch and failed to rally. LUCKY LUCKY LUKE settled off the pace, was roused three then four wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. SON OF AN EX moved out while settling towards the rear, moved closer leaving the backstretch, was roused five wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch and was no factor. ACHILLES HEEL settled on the far outside, was caught six then five wide early on the turn then moved to the three path, reached the two path near the three-eighths and failed to respond. PINEAPPLE MAN settled just off the pace, was urged four then five wide on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Colloquy
ENTRY.OWNER: Murray Robert E and Lyden Michael P
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,2-3path turn,angled 5w3/16,empty,best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Drake's Passage
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace,bid 3-4path turn,lead3/16,prevailed,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Son of an Ex
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved out,settled near back,asked 5w turn,7w1/4,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Justice Racing Stable LLC and Steigmeier Ryan
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,urged 4-5w turn,6w into lane,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Safalow's Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 2path-inside turn, failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Cicciobello
ENTRY.COMMENT: went to front,pace,ins-2path turn,headed3/16,outfinished,clr2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Lucky Luke
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC Celeritas Racing LLC and WLI
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 3-4wide turn, 5wide into lane, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Achilles Heel
ENTRY.OWNER: Nicholas Racing Stable and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,6wide1/2,2p3/8,failed to respond

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allow ed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BALTASAR six paths off the inside down the backstretch in aim of the front, tucked four wide through the turn and was patiently handled while advancing to stack outside the top pair, took over command swinging five wide into upper stretch and was roused straightened away, then edged clear under a drive to prevail. ICE ROAD broke out at the start bumping LEONIDS in tandem with RED D G P, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, got set down angled four wide into upper stretch, ran on to secure the place honors. SKYLANDER got bumped at the start by MAGICAL WAYS, who broke outwards, chased seven paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn, got let out spinning five wide into upper stretch, ran on to procure the show honors. RED D G P broke in at the start bumping LEONIDS in concert with ICE ROAD, came under coaxing and prompted the pace four then two wide loosely between foes, swung three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. LEONIDS got bumped between foes who each broke his way at the start, came under coaxing and established the front soon after and showed the way two to three wide under some pressure from the aforementioned foe to the outside, tucked inside through the turn and came under pressure from a pair, spun just off the inside into upper stretch yielding command at that juncture and weakened in the late going. MAGICAL WAYS broke out at the start bumping SKYLANDER, chased two to three wide until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing three furlongs from home, went six wide into upper stretch and tired. IMPROPER coaxed from the gate, chased four wide down the backstretch before tucking three then two wide through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired. LIFE AND LIGHT stumbled badly at the start falling to his face before recovering, chased five then four wide down the backstretch and then four to three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued three to four wide into upper stretch and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Life and Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled badly st, chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, ins turn, set down 4w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Leonids
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump btw st, cut pace 2-3w, ins turn, yielded 2w 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Red D G P
ENTRY.OWNER: McMahon Joseph G McMahon Anne Buchakjian Kyle Buchakjian Richard and Plummer Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, coaxed, prompted 4-2w, 3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Improper
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4w, 3-2w turn, coaxed 3/8, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Magical Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed ins 3/8, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Skylander
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, 7w backstretch, 3w turn, let out 5w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Baltasar
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w backstretch, 4w turn, up 5w upper, edged clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Hudson Valley S. BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 103. Stakes Purse 125000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE BRED REGISTRY.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DAKOTA GOLD brushed with a rival at the start, settled off the pace, traveled around most of the turn in the two path then shifted four wide, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed fast to get the lead at the three-sixteenths, kicked clear into the final furlong, swapped back to his inside lead near the sixteenth-pole and proved much the best under strong handling. SOMELIKEITHOTBROWN brushed with a foe at the start, settled at the rear, was roused while two then three wide on the turn, swung five wide into the stretch and just got up for the place. JERRY THE NIPPER was rated just off the pace, drafted inside to the two path on the turn, was asked three wide into the stretch, made a bid at the three-sixteenths, lost touch with the winner into the final furlong and proved no match then was caught for the place while clear for the show. HUSH OF A STORM bobbled nearing the seven-eighths, was reserved towards the back, saved ground on the turn, came off the rail outside the quarter-pole, moved out in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. RUSE prompted the pace on the outside then in the two path on the turn, battled under a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. CALL ME HARRY went to the front, showed the way on the inside of a rival, was asked while along the hedge on the turn, lost the lead near the five-sixteenths, dropped back into upper stretch and gave way. COLD HARD CASH was reserved on the outside, went three wide on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch and came up empty then collapsed post race and was reported to have suffered a fatal cardiac event.

ENTRY.NAME: Hush of a Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled 7/8,reserved,ins-2p turn,mvd out3/16,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Dakota Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,settled,2p3/8,4p,5p1/4,rallied,lead3/16,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Somelikeithotbrown
ENTRY.OWNER: Skychai Racing LLC and Koenig David
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,settled at rear,ask 2-3p turn,swung 5w1/4,up for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Jerry the Nipper
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace,ins-2p turn,3p1/4,bid3/16,no match,lost2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Cold Hard Cash
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved outside,3w turn,4w1/4,empty,collapsed post race

ENTRY.NAME: Call Me Harry
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace ins foe,asked rail turn,headed 5/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Ruse
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted outside,2path turn,dropped back 3/16,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 74. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Clai m Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAYTHISBETHEONE chased three wide from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, offered up a good finish to close stoutly on the outside getting up in the final jumps to the finish to score. CONQUIST established the front shortly after the start and showed the way in hand just off the inside, tucked inside half a mile from home, took the inside route into upper stretch set down for the drive, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing late threat and was caught in the final strides to the finish. IMPAZIBLE PRINCE chased two to three wide in closest aim of the leader coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, continued two to three wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick to procure the show honors. ZAPRUDER chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the far turn coming under coaxing midway, angled out five wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild kick. BARRY THE BUILDER broke in brushing the near side stall at the start, rushed up tucking in front of KID EMERALD forcing that rival to steady briefly nearing the seven furlong marker, settled just off the pace just off the inside, came under coaxing along the inside at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and stayed on one paced to the end. IN MY SHADOW tracked the pace along the inside patiently handled, cut the corner roused into upper stretch, kept on to the wire but was outfinished in the late stages. SOCIAL SIDEKICK broke a beat slow and then bobbled slightly and lost his lane, raced three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued three wide into upper stretch, made no headway. OVER THE CAP chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch, made no impact. KID EMERALD got steadied off the heels of BARRY THE BUILDER near the seven-eighths when that rival tucked in front and lost about a length of ground, chased four then three wide to the three-eighths, tucked to the two path at that station and came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and tired. BIG BOULDER chased two to three wide, came under coaxing tucked inside at the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Zapruder
